website_summaries.verdict: Most time and energy efficient way to plant bulbs.
pros: Attach product to a drill, turn on and pull out when auger has gone as deep as possible
Easily reaches 6" - 10" into soil, but some owners have gone as deep as 18"
cons: More difficult to use in hard, clay soil

customer_reviews.title: Worked Well But Two Cautions
customer_reviews.text: Should not have waited so long to purchase one of these to aid in bulb planting. Works well but two cautions: 1. If you have the drill on a high speed and the auger encounters a tough root the drill will jerk out of your hand the spin around so you have to be careful in this regard. 2nd Caution: The drill will get dirty so don't use your husbands most loved and expensive cordless drill. It will get filthy. I have now been instructed to use the older (i.e., hubby doesn't care about that drill) drill......lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl H.

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Makes me look back at all the years of digging holes and shake my head. So happy with this purchase. My 8 year old was able to use it with a little instruction. Don't forget to toggle down the speed on your drill or you will have a dirt shower. I would buy again and recommend to family n friends!
customer_reviews.author: kiwibinx

customer_reviews.title: This worked extremely well for me. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This worked extremely well for me planting bulbs. I am so glad I decided to go for this tool. I have rocks in my soil, and this made planting bulbs a snap. I highly recommend, especially if you have rocky soil.
customer_reviews.author: L. Stark

customer_reviews.title: Loving it!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This tool is amazing! It drilled holes in seconds and the holes were deep enough and wide enough to plant my large tulip bulbs from Costco. I have used augers before but never one like this. What a great gift this will make for all my gardening friends.
customer_reviews.author: Kit

customer_reviews.title: Makes a repetitive task easy
customer_reviews.text: I was building a 16 foot labyrinth made of bottles in my backyard. With the auger bit and a drill I laid the final 100 bottles (where the flags are in the photo) in about 2 hours as opposed to the 24 bottles I could usually place in that time. It is an excellent trenching tool and cultivator. It cut through small tree roots with ease. I am very pleased that I ordered this product.
customer_reviews.author: T. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver..at least a back saver
customer_reviews.text: I had my auger delivered a few days ago and just finished using it. I planted 4 good-sized Chrysanthemums in my back yard. I have a very bad shoulder and heavy arthritis in my ankle so using a shovel is not going to happen. This auger is fantastic. Our soil isn't especially hard and the auger powered through it with ease. I planted all four Mums in about 20 minutes including the time for heavy watering. I will never be without this auger!
customer_reviews.author: JimN

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Better
customer_reviews.text: I never leave reviews... but after a few days of rain I got to work on hard packed clay with queen palm and pigmy date palm roots in every inch. YOU MUST HAVE LOW SPEED on your drill. I used a 12 V cordless and absolutely made short work of both areas. My intention was to just make holes for new ground cover, however I ended up "tilling" all of the dirt, adding admendts, and tilling again. The next day I planted 216 Gaznia. The strength of the auger with the hex drill bit is awesome. Very very well made. Saturate the soil and go to work..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow - This Power Planter is worth every penny! After digging four holes by hand in Indiana clay, I ordered this tool and it was worth it. I used it for 40 holes and accomplished the task in no time at all. You will love this Power Planter, It WORKS!
customer_reviews.author: Button

customer_reviews.title: Well made . Could use a little tweaking.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I wouldn't have to bug my husband to put bulbs in. But since we have garden dirt that a stick of dynamite won't make a dent in this auger only worked if the ground was thoroughly saturated. Even then it took some serious muscle to dig some holes. But it is a very well made tool although I think maybe the end should have more of a pronounced point to help get it going in difficult soil. Price wasn't bad.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty gardening tool!
customer_reviews.text: Northeast Ohio is notorious for clay soil, so when I decided to plant over a hundred bulbs at my new home, I thought I’d give this a try. With this little auger in my electric drill, I had all my holes ready to go in no time. Like other reviews say, just keep your drill speed low in case you hit a rock or root. The black paint wears off the edges and tip after just a few holes, but I was very impressed by how this broke up the soil and did not allow the clay to stick to it. I’ll be using this again in the spring when it’s time to plant flats of annuals.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick A. Toman

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ- planted 100 bulbs so far
customer_reviews.text: I planted over 100 bulbs in no time using this auger, this was in solid ground, not loose dirt. It does get tangled on the grass a bit but I used a post hole digger to removed the top layer of grass then the auger to drill the holes for the bulbs. You will need a heavy duty drill. Be careful of rocks and roots as the drill will twist out of your hand or hurt your wrist if it gets tangled or caught between a "rock and a hard place". :)
customer_reviews.author: M. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Not Ready for Prime Time
customer_reviews.text: Might possibly work in moist soil. In moderately dry black soil, dirt that was removed from bottom of hole simply fell back into hole. No time or labor savings noted. Other reviewer was correct. It also got my favorite drill very muddy. I went back to using a hand planter
customer_reviews.author: Just a Guy

customer_reviews.title: Better than Home Depot's version
customer_reviews.text: I needed a dirt auger so I bought the only model available at Home Depot, and it broke quickly. Bought another one, because nothing else was available at the store, and hoping the first was a fluke, but it broke quickly, too. So went to Amazon and looked for the highest-rated auger, got this one, and it works great. I've used it to dig up poison ivy roots for removal, and to expose some buried plumbing, hitting lots of rocks in the process with both, but my Power Planter remains intact. You get what you pay for, cheapos break easily, but not this one, at least not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bluejay

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I was new ti bulb planting this last fall and wasn't aware of all available techniques. I got this bulb Auger later in the process after spending countless hours digging holes for bulbs in my garden. This tool has simplified the task significantly and streamlined the entire operation. Word of caution - cover the drill with a plastic bag or some sort of wrap, because dirt will get in everywhere. I will be definitely be using this bulb planter next season.
customer_reviews.author: LD

customer_reviews.title: It works so well!
customer_reviews.text: I was able to plant bulbs into some very tough, root filled areas. I waited until after a heavy rain had softened the ground somewhat the day before, and then let the sandy soil drain a bit. I was able to plant 165 bulbs in an hour and a half, without disturbing the areas surrounding the bulb placement. I also used this to very quickly plant some perennials that had been hanging around, waiting to go in the ground. This auger is a great size, and I am happy to have it. I was careful to dry it thoroughly after use, as I want it to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: James Hulme

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tool!
customer_reviews.text: The auger worked well on easier soil. I live where the soil is tight clay and if it hasn't been worked and conditioned it is very difficult. The auger on the non worked bed was very bouncy and did not bore directly down like my conditioned beds. The augur worked superbly in my planter boxes, both as an auger and as a tiller. Altogether, I am pleased with my purchase of the auger and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Hit Man Hearne

customer_reviews.title: I love it, and use it often
customer_reviews.text: I have some of the heaviest clay soil in North Texas. With a good drill (I like my Dewalt) this augur can power into heavy clay and makes it really easy to plant stuff. It's is a huge time saver as digging a decent hole with a spade in my soil is only for a masochist. The only downside is that it tends to scatter the refill material so keep some extra soil on hand when planting.
customer_reviews.author: Jason H

customer_reviews.title: Hoping it works well
customer_reviews.text: I visualized 7" as longer than these really are. My mistake. Since most bulbs are planted 6" deep or less this should be fine. I wanted to 3" diameter because anything less would be problematic with larger bulbs and even smaller bulbs needs a bit of room in loose soil around them. I will plant with this later this fall and will update this.
customer_reviews.author: B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Don't use in clay soil.
customer_reviews.text: I tried using this in Georgia clay, and it did not work at all. The instructions say to use at low speed, but the auger just bogged down in the clay and stopped dead in its tracks. At high speed, it flung clay 5 feet away, leaving a hole but no dirt to back fill around the plant. In a raised bed garden with great black topsoil, it probably works fine though. Highly disappointed, and would like to return for a refund, if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Dale R. Moller

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for spring bulb lovers!
customer_reviews.text: This tool made planting bulbs in hard clay soil so much easier this year. I so wanted to plant a mass of daffodils in a section of my back yard but only managed 3 holes last year, lol. This year my husband helped using this tool and his battery operated hand drill and voila 50 holes for daffodils in back and another 75 for tulips and daffodils in front of my home. It took him maybe 45 minutes, tops. I highly recommend this tool for spring bulb lovers!
customer_reviews.author: Cindi

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit my 3/8 " drill
customer_reviews.text: Too bad but it doesn't fit my 3/8 inch drill so I 'm returning this item. We went to two different hardware stores and the people confirmed that it doesn't fit.
customer_reviews.author: Margie D.

customer_reviews.title: Works well if you don't have roots
customer_reviews.text: This auger works well if there are not roots. Our lawn has multiple roots, causing the drill to violently rotate when the auger hits the roots. This occurs especially with small roots. You also have to either bend over, sit, or be on your knees to use it. It is well built and should last a long time. For planting the sod plugs we used it for, a sod plugger worked much better.
customer_reviews.author: Stu

customer_reviews.title: Need a strong drill and damp soil
customer_reviews.text: It's very sturdily made and I think it'll last, but I found my drill underpowered when it came to areas with roots and also if the soil is dry it just kind of tosses it around without really digging. I also wish I'd gotten a longer shaft than 7". I thought it'd be sufficient for doing 6" depth planting, but I found I had to push deeper to deal with the fact the hole kept caving in on itself when the soil isn't very damp.
customer_reviews.author: AGS

customer_reviews.title: Finally a way to plant more bulbs in my concrete like soil!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my soil is so hard, clay. When I first moved into my house I was given a rose bush. It was December in CA. It was cold but thought the ground frozen! If I only had this great gadget! The bit is thick, and seems sturdy. I used 1 time in hot weather and was quite impressed with how fast it did the job! I watched some You tube videos on how to use the item as it is quite powerful. The manufacturer does recommend the videos too. I think this is one of the best garden purchases ever!
customer_reviews.author: chloemom

customer_reviews.title: Best thing ever to plant bulbs!!
customer_reviews.text: Why didn't I buy one of these sooner! Used this to plant several packs of tulip bulbs and to replant some daffodils. Drill the holes where you want them (note: be sure to use both hands on the drill in case you hit a rock or roots in order to keep you wrist from being strained by the torque of the drill), drop in the bulbs, cover and done. The auger is the correct depth for most bulbs. This year every bulb that i planted came up and bloomed this springs. Wish I had purchased one of these sooner!!
customer_reviews.author: IM

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy! Get the feel of this excellent tool!
customer_reviews.text: We love this auger!! It’s super sturdy and made in the US! It barrels through our tough clay very well. There is a learning curve so you need to get the feel of it. Start slow and maybe go in the ground and then back out from time to time. Also helps to have a drill with a stabilizer handle. My husband just bought a new hammer drill with stabilizer and we can’t wait to try it with that. I definitely recommend this product and may buy a few as gifts!
customer_reviews.author: M. E. McNulty

customer_reviews.title: Makes bulb planting so fast
customer_reviews.text: I just finished planting 130 tulip and daffodil bulbs in my yard in record time with this auger attached to my cordless drill. Only place it did not work perfect was in areas with rocky soil, there some additional hand digging was required. Very glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Durgin

customer_reviews.title: Probably works great for Superman
customer_reviews.text: I have a great drill and this did not work like they say. It might work if you the the strength to contain it but if that was the case it would be easier to dig the holes with out this attachement. One of the few things that made me cuss out loud.
customer_reviews.author: SoyPreciosa

customer_reviews.title: If you can hold on, this thing is incredible!
customer_reviews.text: Be prepared, use a drill with a side handle. This thing tears through our clay soil, roots, and small rocks. It will rip the drill from your hands or maybe even injure your wrists. I just used this, with an extension, to dig 12” deep post holes for a garden arbor. It worked like magic! I’ll be ordering a spare. This is my favorite tool of all time, this week.
customer_reviews.author: B a r r y

customer_reviews.title: Useful tool
customer_reviews.text: I live on a farm and have a landscaping business, so planting is part of the routine. This tool has made life much easier. Want to plant hasta, easy. Want to plant a small tree, no problem. Just get out your power drill, put this tool in, and go to town. Yo have to have a strong hand, but you get used to handling this tool and the feel of the motion once you use it once. After that, you can plant a garden in no time. Seems to hold up well too, so quality is no problem. I am considering the extra long one for bigger trees. I do recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Comstock

customer_reviews.title: Power Planter is Fun
customer_reviews.text: We finally had a chance to plant our bag of 70 daffodils today and it was wonderfully easy to do, thanks to our new power planter. My daughter screw-dug the holes and I planted and filled them and we were done in about 20 minutes! Fortunately the soil was moist not clay-like as it can be here in Ohio so it was easy to do...hole stayed put, really easy to dig and also to put back. The sol is sprayed around by the blades. JKS Too new to rate on "durability", but it's pretty sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: jks

customer_reviews.title: Works well but not in all soil types
customer_reviews.text: I got this to plant fall bulbs. It works well in fairly loose soil but just can’t drill into clay or compacted soil. Even with a new battery on the drill, the auger would slip and then get stuck. I used a drill that has been able to drill into concrete so that wasn’t the issue. It’s did the job I needed it to in most areas and was definitely better than hand digging 50 or more holes.
customer_reviews.author: Labchick

customer_reviews.title: Made planting bulbs a snap
customer_reviews.text: Recently bought a hundred or so spring bulbs for fall planting, and hubs surprised me with this little drill attachment. (No such thing as a tool you don't need, just one you don't have yet!) But this made digging through tough sometimes rocky dirt, and getting perfectly spaced and deep holes a snap. Planted a hundred bulbs way quicker than I could have done with a spade, or even one of those hand held bulb planters. I'm impressed, and pretty happy. And hubs is pretty happy with himself.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: Love this item. Very sturdy and dealt with small rocks easily. Planted 45 bulbs in very little time with minimum effort. My soil is red clay that has been worked some over the years and not compacted. There was an area of red soil that was compacted, and it didn't work there. Had to go back to using the mattock there. There are definitely going to be more bulbs in my future.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah M Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but worth it
customer_reviews.text: The power planter worked well, and I will buy others from this company; however, I was disappointed that part of the curved part of the auger chipped off during the initial use. Thankfully, the small, broken edge didn’t impact overall performance, and I planted all the bulbs easily, but I was disappointed to have the edge break off so early on day one. That said, I do recommend this product; I planted roughly 75 bulbs in about half hour or less.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong, So I Don’t Have to Be
customer_reviews.text: I previously owned a somewhat flimsy auger for planting bulbs, but saw this recommended on a gardening site. This auger is super sturdy and should hold up for many years. Since I plant hundreds of bulbs every fall, I appreciate how much easier this makes it to handle the work. I bought the shorter auger, as I have a small gardening chair I work from, but I feel the taller version would also be a great addition to my tools.
customer_reviews.author: clsact

customer_reviews.title: Great for planting flowers
customer_reviews.text: Works well for digging holes in flower beds and for mixing in potting oil. My only suggestion: Could use a longer reach on the drill bit end. Minor issue as I really like this mini post hole digger. As my Dad taught me on the farm, always clean up your tools at the end of the job. As a result, I am still using a spade I bought 45 years ago, by taking care of it at the end of the job.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne W

customer_reviews.title: As good as the other reviews I read
customer_reviews.text: I had to dig 50+ holes in rocky, hard, clay soil, it woudl have been hours of hard, nasty labor, with this tool it took about 20 minutes. I don't know how it will wear, this was my first use, but it already was well worth the $ I spent on it. Well made, in USA no less, doesn't dig huge holes but perfect for planting little plants or getting a bigger hole started
customer_reviews.author: Kenwoodrobb

customer_reviews.title: Dig In Drier Soil ?
customer_reviews.text: We had a bag of Daffodil Bulbs to plant... Normally we would do in the Fall ... however, we decided to do yesterday April 25th... it was difficult because soil was wet... perhaps drier soil would be easier... we just thought using the Auger would be easier... still better than digging by hand. We will most definitely bury the other half of the bag in the Fall...
customer_reviews.author: Linda Roesener

customer_reviews.title: 👍👍👍👍👍👍
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had known about this many moons ago in my gardening history. What an easy way to dig holes! But it is tricky to use. My advice is go really slow until you get the hang of it. I’m sure it could Cause a badly sprained wrist if not used with caution. But all said and I love how easy & quick it is now to dig holes for planting!!️
customer_reviews.author: jennM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tool
customer_reviews.text: Worked great!! Used it this past weekend to plant several dozen lily bulbs and it worked beautifully. I had no issues with it at all, it took care of small rocks and roots, and did exactly what I needed it to do. Very happy with this product and would highly recommend it for anyone who's looking to plant bulbs in any type of soil.
customer_reviews.author: Dark_Jedi

customer_reviews.title: God's Gift to Gardeners!
customer_reviews.text: This tool is a must if you dig even one hole! We have a steep rocky hill and this tough little tool is perfect for digging holes in rocky ground! Truly it is a gift from God - a huge help for digging in rocky dirt. The 3"X7" works perfect for even bigger holes, you just grind out the hole as big as you need. The tool is durable and strong and digs up rocks of all sizes with little effort. I wish I knew about this 300 plants ago!
customer_reviews.author: Lilly

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to plant about 1000 bulbs & it works great! I’m using an old cord style drill because it does get dirty and I don’t have to worry about dead batteries. I’ve been working in some packed, rocky dirt with small tree roots so in some spots it’s a bit slow going but it still works. Without this mini auger I would’ve given up already. Sometimes I have to wiggle it around or drill in at an angle but that’s not a big deal to me. I also use my hands to scoop the loose dirt out of the holes. I’m super happy with this purchase & definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C.Kessler

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I have used it a lot this spring. Very sturdy. I have found I can make the hole bigger by drilling homes near it. Very well made. I wish I had brought a longer one. If you hit a rock or root it will twist your arm. I put it on drill as they have in directions. I would buy again. It will last a long time and much better than using a shovel. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: ChltBob

customer_reviews.title: A good gardening gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for a man who loves gardening. Once he saw what it was, he was pretty excited that he wouldn't have to hand dig his flower beds to plant his flowers and bulbs. I haven't used it personally, but it was pretty solidly put together and not something I was worried would fall apart. If it doesn't workout for him, I'll keep this updated
customer_reviews.author: JMMorton

customer_reviews.title: Power digger
customer_reviews.text: On wow. My garden was mulched over the weekend. I planted my annuals today. I love to garden so this item is a gem I moved the mulch gently, drilled a hole, and dropped my flower in. I planted flats of zinnias, dahlias and petunias in 1/4 the time it would have taken me without this power digger. No mess and I gently moved the mulch back. This is my new best gardening friend.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well engineered product, built tough!
customer_reviews.text: I don't leave reviews for most purchases. After reading lower star reviews for this product I decided to. This product is sturdily built, and does a great job. I have fairly heavy, “builder's clay” soil. This auger goes right through it. True, some spoils will go back in the hole... so what? The hard part is done! If you set the drill to “no clutch” sure a tree root will jerk. Read/follow directions
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE YOU, AUGER.
customer_reviews.text: If you have rocky clay soil, like us, or a bunch of holes to dig this will be your BFF. We used ours with our ryobi hand drill. It seriously was a lifesaver!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Works Very Well In Hard Clay for Sod Plugs
customer_reviews.text: I used this 3" auger tool to plant Palmetto St. Augustine plugs in my front yard. I have fairly hard clay and this tool dug over 300 holes without having any problems. This tool is more meant for bulbs but the diameter was perfect for 3"x3" plugs. Other than paint being scraped off the edges of the auger, it is no worse for the wear. It sure made easy work of my sod plugging project.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Power Planter Bulb & Bedding Plant Auger 3"x7" (10 STAR not 5 star).
customer_reviews.text: Power Planter 100% USA Made 3"x7" Bulb & Bedding Plant Auger. This is a great usable sturdy tool. Saves a lot of time sprigging St Augustine grass. I would recommend any of Bulb & Bedding Plant Auger tools to anybody. (It is we’ll made). It is not like that crap made in China. You can even look and tell it's made in the USA before you even use it. It is a (10 STAR not 5 star).
customer_reviews.author: Charles Mayton

customer_reviews.title: Planting annuals made super easy!
customer_reviews.text: It literally took us about 30 mins to plant 80+ plants and the flower beds look fantastic! Only took about 20 secs to drill a hole. We have fairly soft flower beds, no rocks or stones, but we do have a bit of clay. This tool made is so easy to plant! We purchased our flowers for $6.99 a flat of 9, bought this tool, and did it ourselves. We had two bids of $250 to plant for us. We saved $$ and will save even more because now we'll already own this tool! It's a purchase I wish I had made years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: The long and short of it...
customer_reviews.text: This is way too short, 7 inch model. Returned it. There is no room between the bit and the top of the auger blade/flange, so when producing a hole in the soil the dirt comes up around the drill. Not good for the drill. I have ordered a different product that provides the adequate space/distance.
customer_reviews.author: fppilot

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for moderately hard bed.
customer_reviews.text: Had my doubts but this thing saved me a lot of time, effort, and aggravation. I admit that the ground was not super packed but it was not super soft either. This week I’ll try it on an see that hasn’t seen a shovel in a hundred years and will update. I do wish it were a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: Mary lewis

customer_reviews.title: a necessity
customer_reviews.text: if you have a limited time frame, or if you have compacted clay soil, or if you're old and stiff and sore, you need this to make planting many bulbs easy. what a great tool! as a winter storm approached, i only had an afternoon to plant over 100 bulbs. i got it done in 2 1/2 hours. no way i could have done this without the auger. worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T. Heine

customer_reviews.title: Impressive results
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Power Planter 3"x7" Bulb & Bedding Plant Auger for my wife’s use. She planted 156 individual plants with the Power Planter within 2 days of its arrival. She was very impressed needless to say. This tool is a big labor saver; it is indescribable and comes with very good instructions for safe use. Email communication by the seller about the product and was also a nice surprise. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Harris

customer_reviews.title: So much easier!
customer_reviews.text: Like the other reviewers said, make sure your drill is on low speed or it will take your arm off. I used it to make planting holes in hay bales and I could easily go as deep or wide as I needed, saving me a lot of work cutting by hand. I love this option!
customer_reviews.author: LisaJ

customer_reviews.title: broke in clay
customer_reviews.text: First time I used it was in clay. It had a hard time engaging in the soil. The second day I used it the welds snapped. Welds can withstand a lot of pressure in general which makes me wonder the standard they used when welding. Would not recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Huge Labor Saver
customer_reviews.text: I made a mistake and ordered what turned out to 50 bulbs. My soil is hard pan clay with stones and tree roots. After planting 20 bulbs, I ordered this auger and the remaining bulbs were in the ground within an hour. Some deep stones and tree roots larger than 1/2" diameter took a little extra work. I recommend using a side handle on your drill and pay attention to the suggestion to rotate the auger very slowly to avoid having the drill wrenched out of your hand. Altogether: a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Robert G.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and fast
customer_reviews.text: I ordered and utilized the power auger because I had 150 bulbs to plant. The planting went very well and the auger was up to the task, even in rocky soil. I used an 18 volt drill with a side handle attached (recommended), on low speed to cut the holes. Would definitely purchase again if needed. I did make a cardboard template to drill through that would capture the removed soil and make it easier to recover the dirt and place it back in the hole.
customer_reviews.author: J. Tymecki

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: My husband thought this would be a waste of money, and boy was he wrong! (I love it when that happens)! So easy to use, it just made my planting super easy this year. If you need a bigger hole, you can certainly do that and it can go a lot deeper if you just move aside the already turned dirt. A great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Andra

customer_reviews.title: Durable and informative video
customer_reviews.text: I would strongly recommend to watch the video on youtube before starting to work with it. I started doing it without watching the video. The settings in your drill tool is important, otherwise it really gets on your wrist. Video helped. The item is sturdy and durable.
customer_reviews.author: ZabeD

customer_reviews.title: This is a solid auger built to last
customer_reviews.text: The soil in Atlanta has a high clay content making it difficult to plant bulbs and plants. This auger makes a breeze of the job by drilling holes where bulbs can be dropped in and you can choose to add Miracle-Gro and topsoil or manure to nourish growth. I want to buy their biggest augur and boy the motorized augur head for larger jobs. This augur pays back its cost with as little as 10 uses. What a great quality product !!!
customer_reviews.author: Jayant

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We used an 18v cordless Makita 3/8” drill & it works perfectly! We used it to dig holes for our vegetable plants. Wish I had this years ago. It digs a hole perfectly sized for a 4” pot or smaller. We had 1 gallon pots too- just used the auger to widen the hole & pushed a bit deeper. Well- made & sturdy. 2 thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Gravelle

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is my second auger purchase. I bought a cheaper one that was no match for my compact clay soil and broke after 6 holes were dug. This one was much sturdier and made it quick and easy to plant all my tulips. This was a good purchase that I am sure will be a tool I use for years.
customer_reviews.author: T. Baxter

customer_reviews.title: If you have a garden give this a shot to speed up planting  up
customer_reviews.text: It's springtime and time to get the flowers planted. Guessed this might be a gimmick but it actually works well. I hoped the shaft would have been longer to avoid dirt getting around the head of the drill but it makes things easier to plant.
customer_reviews.author: Bob G

customer_reviews.title: Made my bulb planting so easy!
customer_reviews.text: A gardening friend recommended this type of planting auger. It was so easy to use and made planting my bulbs so much faster and easier. It churned through my clay soil like it was butter. Well worth the money. You will need a cordless, electric drill to make this work in your garden.
customer_reviews.author: Never Pay Retail!

customer_reviews.title: Awesome garden tool
customer_reviews.text: We just had a chance to use our new auger. It is a wonder tool. My husband did not want to share. I may need to purchase a separate one for myself. This really is an awesome tool. Well worth the money. Very sturdy. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Baldwinda

customer_reviews.title: A real time-saver!
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is supposed to do. It’s a real time-saver when planting lots of bulbs or bare-root plants. Be sure to set your drill to use the clutch if you might run into rocks or tree roots. Using it in “drill mode” without clutch will be rough and painful on your wrists if tree roots or rocks are encountered.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A Jahnke

customer_reviews.title: Depends on your soil.
customer_reviews.text: I live in Texas and we have a clay type of soil. I just used this and it was really had to dig very deep. I think if you have nice loose soil it will be fine. Wish it had worked better. Great concept.
customer_reviews.author: sw

customer_reviews.title: Great product, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with this product and I would definitely recommend It to anyone. Not only does it work perfectly but it’s sturdy and holding up great. I literally used it so much the paint is wore off but it works as well as the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Time Saving!
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased over 200 plants for two large flower beds. I planned on spending most of the Memorial Day weekend planting. I had already marked the hole locations, so it went incredibly fast with the plant auger--about ten minutes to do the entire two beds. Planting the flowers was incredibly simple as the auger had made the exact right size hole for my 2-1/2 pots. I finished the entire project in only a couple of hours!
customer_reviews.author: Nicky

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price!!
customer_reviews.text: These days you would be hard pressed to find a quality item for any purpose. Everything is cheaply made and disposable. Not so with this item.. It is strong and very effective at planting bulbs, veggie plants, annuals, perennials, and anything else you need to plant. I am very impressed. A must have for any gardener. A+++
customer_reviews.author: President & CEO

customer_reviews.title: IT IS JUST THE BEST THING EVER!
customer_reviews.text: This is just THE BEST THING EVER! I’ve had mine a year. This year I’ve transplanted over 10,000 daffodils and 500 daylilies using this auger. I’ve also just “tilled” rows for my garden using it. It is absolutely positively my FAVORITE THING. I have recommended it to all my gardening friends. And no...I’m not being paid to say this. I’m just an avid gardener and this tool has made my life so much easier!
customer_reviews.author: kindle

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I used it with my DeWALT 16v Drill for planting bulbs along an outbuilding, and rows of small plants in a garden with soft clay soil. And it was a big time saver and helped keep rows straight, I just needed to learn not to drill into the soil too fast. I look forward to using it for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable bit holder needed
customer_reviews.text: I am so excited at the potential......problem is that I have a Bosch drill which does not adjust to the size needed. I just tried to find a bit holder that might work. No luck. Any suggestions? dianaj1964@yahoo.com
customer_reviews.author: Diana J Harwood

customer_reviews.title: What a great idea for gardners
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this augur is wonderful. It's sturdy, works as advertised, easy to use. Made in the USA! Directions in real English! My sister already wants to borrow mine but I think I'll get her one for her birthday.
customer_reviews.author: cantthinkofacatchyname

customer_reviews.title: The augur works
customer_reviews.text: I received the augur earlier this week. I tried it "briefly" today. Maybe 5 minutes of use. I live in Reno, Nevada and the area I am trying to plant flowers in is very dry and rocky. The dried up "clay" is like concrete. In the few minutes I used the augur it was able to make a small hole. My DeWalt 14.4 V hand drill was really rocking in that hard dried clay but the augur did make a dent. I will do more next week and maybe post another review after a more rigorous workout.
customer_reviews.author: C. Reno

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy bulb planting
customer_reviews.text: I ordered about 100 bulbs to plant in my flowerbeds without really thinking about digging 100 holes. This tool looked like it would be the perfect solution to my planting problem. I haven't received my bulbs yet, but I went out with the drill to test my new "toy". I can't wait to get my bulbs, as I will have 100 perfect little holes in my yard in no time! Just be careful around bigger plants with established root systems. I will undoubtedly recommend this tool to any gardener who will listen.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy bulb planting!
customer_reviews.text: You can plant a lot of bulbs in a short time. A good drill to drive the auger is a must; I use an 18 volt battery drill. The auger smooth round shaft so it will show wear when working in stoney and/or rooty soil; drill chuck also loosens due to auger impacts with buried obstructions. Patience is needed when boring bulb holes because of soil conditions because you have to drill/withdraw/drill some holes. Also found wearing a glove on the drill hand helps to keep from getting a blister on your drill hand when putting in over 50 at a session due to drill movement.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler12

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it once, but I love it. Seems well made and durable. I used it on slow speed and did not have a issue with the dirt spraying every where. It did get a little away from me when I hit a rock. If you have a lower setting on your drill I recommend using it. This tool will save you a lot of time and labor. Happy planting!
customer_reviews.author: Jo Momma

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Where have you been all my life? This tool is fantastic! I have clay soil that is incredibly hard to dig in. I bought this to plant bulbs and it cut my digging time in half at least. Definitely watch the video before using...I would have done it wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Incredible bulb digger! HEAVY DUTY!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first but this is one serious auger. I planted 200 bulbs yesterday in loam, sand soil and also rocky clay type soil. Not one issue, it peeled those small rocks out like potatoes! Just watch your wrist when using a high torque drill.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: It may be small, but it’s a work saver.
customer_reviews.text: I love it! I planted a variety of plants today, some small and some not so small. I found out very quickly how to make the holes the size I wanted and it just tore through the dirt with no problem. Can’t wait for fall to plant my bulbs, it will be so easy this year!
customer_reviews.author: RLO

customer_reviews.title: Works Well - Real Time Saver!
customer_reviews.text: It takes a little getting used to, esp if you're working in clay which can be very resistant. Go slowly at first and use a low-speed and low-torque setting on drill so that it doesn't get ripped out of your hand which could hurt! Other than that, I love it and will use it in the future - wish I had bought one years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Works well as expected.
customer_reviews.text: For safety reasons, I would recommend the 3"x24"version so the cutting edge of the auger is further from the drill when installing, removing and using. For this reason, I gave a three star rating on ease of use. I remove the battery from the drill when installing and removing the auger to avoid a mishap.
customer_reviews.author: Garth Groft

customer_reviews.title: Robust 7”, 3” Dia auger for planting
customer_reviews.text: Chucks into drill motor fine. Not ideal for heavy souls like clay. Well made. Drill motor should have a horizontal handle to resist twisting. A cordless drill motor is preferred, with 18v battery pak.
customer_reviews.author: PENMEISTER

customer_reviews.title: Does the job advertised
customer_reviews.text: Unlike other users , I used this to transplant. I had 3 large Hostas I dug up a split. I figured if it will work for bulbs, I’ll try it for this. Fantastic ! I had 12 new starts to put in, various root sizes. As you know, hostas do well in the shade, which means roots from other plants. This did fantastic. Transplanted those 12 starts in under 10 minutes! Cut threw all roots, could make holes 10” deep and 5-6” in diameter. A previous person recommended to by a cheaper battery powered drill. I agree. Dirt goes everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bummed
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to get this after seeing the reviews. I have extremely hard dirt/soil where I was trying to dig up to plant and it was not making a dent in the dirt, the bit would just spin and spin and spin. Gave up, went back to using a pick to dig up the dirt
customer_reviews.author: J.s

customer_reviews.title: bulb paanter
customer_reviews.text: This works great for digging bulb plants. Be careful if you have tree roots close by because the drill will hurt your wrist when it gets tangled in the root. But I love this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Karl

customer_reviews.title: 6" is a little short for some bulb work
customer_reviews.text: Ended up having to buy the 12" one to do the daffodils deep enough. Otherwise it worked like a charm in our loose mountain soil. Just used a light battery powered dewalt drill, and was able to do a hundred plus holes in an hour using just two batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Cali Sun Chaser

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long?!
customer_reviews.text: I live in an area with hard rocky soil and needed to plant a lot of bulbs. I’m not as young as I used to be and dreaded digging all those holes. Heard about these through on-line bloggers. It arrived as promised and I used it this past weekend during a warm spell to drill out 35 holes in about 10 minutes! I was so thrilled! It managed to pull small rocks right up out of the hole and dug through the heavy soil with no effort!
customer_reviews.author: Connie in NJ

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: My husband used it to dig the holes to plant the potatoes. He was very impressed how quickly it dug the holes! He said it was great! It really cut down on the time of digging the holes with a small shovel!
customer_reviews.author: Linda R.

customer_reviews.title: My shovel was easier to use
customer_reviews.text: My experience with this augur was quite different from many of those posted, and I'm returning it. The augur is sturdy and very well-made, but I wound up using my shovel instead. The problems are as follows: when drilling into the ground it wobbled in the drill; when I stopped drilling, there was significant kickback that hurt my wrist; and it does not drill into any kind of soil. Mine has a lot of clay and it did not penetrate. It was nigh impossible to drill a 6" hole except in soft soil. Next time I'm going for a longer augur, perhaps from the same company.
customer_reviews.author: BrooklynConsumer

customer_reviews.title: Made planting the grass plugs easier
customer_reviews.text: I had bought a auger at the local box store and after the 3rd hole I dug in the Texas clay soil with rocks in it the drill twisted the bit in 1/2. Bought this one and was big enough to plant glass plugs. Went through the clay soil with little effort. No issues with it at all
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handy little tool.
customer_reviews.text: This tool works very well. It breaks up hard soil quickly, and throughly. You must hang onto the drill tightly, it is powerful. I planted approximately 100 bulbs in less than 2 hours. It works well, to break up soil, for seed planting too.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Mary 4

customer_reviews.title: Great for raised bed gardens
customer_reviews.text: I used this right away to plant blackberry plants, worked perfect, very easy to use and fast. Saves any digging. Good quality, American made, very pleased. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Wildlife

customer_reviews.title: Excellent time saver
customer_reviews.text: The other reviews were spot on. This is a heavyweight, durable piece of machinery. I was weary of the jerk...& still nearly ripped my hand off & dislocated my wrist. But, I still use it!! Planted over 300 bulbs this fall with it, and I’m sure I’ll plant countless more!
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Great product, highly recommend over MANY others.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife. I ended up doing the planting for her because this auger was fun to use. Great construction, durability, and didn't drain my cordless drill battery while I used it. Maybe I'll let her use it next time.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E Byron

customer_reviews.title: Solid piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: Our ground is fairly rocky, so I didn't relish the idea of digging up pockets for planting. Decided to buy this small auger to see if would make my life easier. Boy did it! This thing is HEAVY and feels solid. The welds are beautiful on it by the way. Made short work of rocky soil and didn't even flinch.
customer_reviews.author: C Lee

customer_reviews.title: Wow! What a tool.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product for my husband to plant bulbs. We have a new house and lots of landscaping to do. Our soil is mostly clay and he used this product to plant over 70 bulbs in an hour. He said it was the greatest tool to use for planting. Now he wants to get more bulbs and keep planting.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Jenkins

product_meta.title: Power Planter 100% USA Made 3"x7" Bulb & Bedding Plant Auger
feature_bullets: 100% MADE IN THE USA, with USA sourced materials. Made by family farmers for over 30 years for your garden
Ideal bulb and bedding plant auger, Drills holes in all types of soil
Non-Slip Hex Drive, fits any 3/8-inch drill
Lifetime Warranty on craftsmanship and materials

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,552 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
